column4: Can someone please help me dig myself out of this mess I'm in?

Holy hell, I've asked questions already. Right now, I have a computer with no boot manager that is trying to load over a network. This started when no one would tell me how I can use or get rid of the Windows boot manager because it wouldn't let me install.
what are you trying to install?
so when you try to install kubuntu you are getting errors?
I cant even get to the install yet.
okay why not... I'm sorry I missed your original problem. I caught something about you are trying a network install?
I deleted my boot manager and windows partition while tinkering.
okay.
do you have physical access to the machine?
and do you need to recover your windows partition? Or are you just trying to install kubuntu alone.
at this point neither of those seems possible. I'd prefer to just get kubuntu installed though.
do you have a kubuntu cd?
yes
then boot the kubuntu cd.
that's the problem. There's nothing to boot it.
your bios controls what the machine trys to boot first. Not the boot manager on the physical hard drive.
my bios seems to hate me.
why is that? can you change the boot sequence?
yes. I've moved everything up, down, on, off, and it seems to make no difference at all in the behaviour.
well you would make the cdrom first then the hard drive second etc.... Then save the configuration.
Why do you think you deleted your windows partition?
do you want to join #ubuntu-classroom theres a little less chat in there it would be easier to follow.
sure.
let me know when you are there. you can /j #ubuntu-classroom
